remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceFilteringEventArgs> class is used to pass data to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Filtering> event handler of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceFilteringEventArgs.ParameterValues%2A> property provides access to the filter parameter values before the filtering operation is performed. You can cancel the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Select%2A> method by setting the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceFilteringEventArgs> to `true`. Filtering is supported when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.DataSourceMode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceMode.DataSet> value.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to retrieve data from the Northwind database and filter it using a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.FilterExpression%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.FilterParameters%2A>. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.FilterExpression%2A> of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> is applied anytime the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Select%2A> method is executed to retrieve data. In this example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.FilterExpression%2A> contains a placeholder for a filter parameter, which is contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.FilterParameters%2A> collection. In the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Filtering> event, the filter parameter is displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Label> control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceFilteringEventArgs> class is used to pass data to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Filtering> event handler of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource>. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceFilteringEventArgs.ParameterValues%2A> property provides access to the filter parameter values before the filtering operation is performed.
> [!IMPORTANT] > You should validate any filter parameter values that you receive from the client and cancel the select operation if there are invalid parameters. The runtime simply substitutes the parameter value into the filter expression and applies it to the result of the select method. It is possible for compromised values to alter the filter expression in such a way as to reveal more rows than might otherwise be visible to the client. If you are using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.FilterExpression%2A> property as a security measure to limit the number of items that are returned, you must validate the parameter values before the filtering occurs.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to retrieve data from the Northwind database and filter it using a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.FilterExpression%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.FilterParameters%2A>. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.FilterExpression%2A> of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> is applied anytime the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Select%2A> method is executed to retrieve data. In this example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.FilterExpression%2A> contains a placeholder for a filter parameter, which is contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.FilterParameters%2A> collection. In the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Filtering> event, the filter parameter is displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Label> control.
